title: So Ryze might just be a Shuriman
body:
So for those who don't know, Human Ryze has been renamed to Young Ryze and is pretty much his canonical appearance as a young man (or close to it). What's interesting though is that his clothes and skin tone, which to me seems a tad darker than many other human champions, indicates he's potentially Shuriman. Couple this with the desert and Shuriman themed architecture in Young Ryze's splash art and I'm led to believe that Ryze was Shuriman born or visited ancient Shurima in his early days, keeping in mind that he's now centuries old.

https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-xiXGiwVNn8M/V3Loglf3FxI/AAAAAAAAQ-s/EIWsRhfDn7AHLTlj-Tv0QsfToDmrFEpiACKgB/s1600/ryze1turn.jpg

You can't look at that building behind the magic around Ryze's hand and tell me it doesn't look like the Palace of Ten Thousand Pillars (The building with the Sun Disc above it).

I mean we'll probably get solid information with his new lore, but hey, I saw something interesting and wanted to play detective, so sue me.

EDIT: Reav3 has confirmed that Ryze isn't Shuriman, and really doesn't belong to any one nation, but he has been to Shurima as the splash art suggests.

Along with the fact they were deliberate warfare of sentient species... The hype is real! Riot would not let the Rune wars disappear.

Wishful thinking. Ryze doesn't have a single shred of Noxian Idealogy. He has basically placed the duty of safeguarding the world on himself-- a Noxian wouldn't do that, they'd believe that the strong shouldn't be prevented from power if they can obtain it, and so Ryze would be taking the runes for himself instead of protecting the world. Regardless of birthplace and original goals, he's now a Nomadic individual, much like Poppy, who will keep searching for the Runes to prevent another Runewar.
Also Demacia and Noxus are relatively recent and Ryze is more than 1000 years old.

I'd say he's probably Icathian. The symbols simply 'look' Icathian, and can somewhat look a lot like the ones on Malzahar's old coat. Along with that, people have been speculating a lore event like Shurima's and Mount Targon's for the Void, and another Icathian champion sounds good for a nice entrance into an event like that (Taliyah's the reason we got the Shuriman event, and Aurelion Sol was for Mount Targon). The only special interaction I get from Ryze in his VO video is when he tells Malzahar in a grumpy sarcastic tone something along the lines of {{champion:13}} "Oh, you, the one who let all the void-beasts free. Yea, _great_ idea..." So it sounds like he knows a bit more about Malzahar after all, which can mean we get more lore on him as well.
